captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Quinn and Valor, Demacia’s Wings.
With high mobility and clever tricks, Quinn and Valor can chase down fleeing prey, or escape from sticky situations.
Throughout the game you’ll be playing as either Quinn, a ranged DPS with a crossbow, or Valor, a swift melee-range eagle.
Quinn’s passive is Harrier. Every few seconds, Valor marks a nearby enemy, causing Quinn’s next basic attack against that target deal bonus damage.
Harrier will always mark targets you’re attacking, but if you’re not hitting anything, then it will mark nearby enemy champions, or low-health minions.
Blinding Assault sends Valor out in a line, stopping on the first enemy he encounters to damage and blind all nearby enemies.
Note that if you’re looking to blind high-damage targets far away, it can be blocked by enemies up close.
Heightened Senses passively grants Quinn bonus attack speed whenever she attacks a target marked by Harrier.
When activated, Valor flies up to reveal the surrounding area.
Note that this reveal is not extremely long-range, and works best for revealing enemies lurking nearby. You should still buy wards.
Vault causes Quinn to dash to target enemy, damaging and slowing it before leaping back off. Vaulting to an enemy will also mark it with Harrier.
If Vault is used close up, Quinn will disengage from her target and leap back to full attack range.
If used from farther away, Quinn will Vault as though she’s chasing an enemy, and actually end up closer than she was before.
Tag Team is their ultimate.
When cast, Valor swoops in and replaces Quinn on the battlefield, attacking from melee range,
augmenting all their basic abilities and granting massive bonus movement speed.
If Valor enters combat, this movement speed decays down to a lower bonus, but returns after exiting combat.
At the end of Tag Team’s duration, or when re-activated, Quinn uses Skystrike,
returning to the battlefield in a hail of arrows that damages all nearby enemies, dealing bonus damage to those low on health.
When playing as Valor, Blinding Assault damages and blinds enemies nearby, instead of flying out in a line.
When playing as Valor, Heightened Senses passively grants even more attack speed than normal all the time as the passive Harrier is disabled during Tag Team.
The active effect is unchanged and still reveals the surrounding area.
When playing as Valor, Vault dashes to target enemy, damaging and slowing your foe, but not marking or leaping off the target afterward.
In early laning, Quinn should look to attack champions who’ve been marked by Harrier.
Here Quinn trades with Draven, leading with Blinding Assault and landing a basic attack, dropping him to 2/3 health without taking anything in return.
However, enemies can see the Harrier mark, and will often back off, relying on a teammate to counter-attack her.
Lux lands an attack as Quinn chases Ezreal, and then Ezreal hits Quinn when she targets Lux.
Quinn players should be aware of their surroundings and not get caught up in the pursuit.
When enemies come to gank Quinn, she should first get between the ganker and safety,
then use Vault as a gap-opener to propel herself away from danger while simultaneously slowing her assailant.
Then she can land an easy basic attack for extra damage thanks to the mark from Harrier.
Vault is also an amazing tool for securing kills.
Nami lands Aqua Prison, so Quinn follows up with Vault as a gap-closer, which slows Ezreal and allows her to keep attacking.
Quinn chases and uses Flash to pick up the kill.
To get some quick attack speed, hit something with Vault and attack it.
Vault instantly applies the mark from Harrier, allowing Quinn to gain bonus attack speed via Heightened Senses.
This is the best way to clear out jungle camps or minion waves quickly.
Their assassination potential really spikes up at level 6. Tag Team grants a burst of movement speed and Vault pins down Lux.
Despite being Exhausted, Quinn puts out more damage by casting Skystrike early to burst her down.
Now in ranged form, Blinding Assault and basic attacks kill Ezreal without needing to enter the turret’s attack range.
Lux is low enough that Nami dives the turret to take her down as well.
Quinn has both great up-front damage and chasing ability to follow up ganks in her lane.
She puts out early pressure with Harrier and Vault, causing Ezreal to run with Arcane Shift and Flash.
However, Tag Team allows Valor to quickly close the gap and gets right back into range, picking up the kill with Skystrike.
Even if none of Quinn’s teammates are in range to deal any damage, Valor can still make that happen.
Vi and Nami look to dive Ezreal, but it’s Tag Team into Vault that closes the gap and locks him down.
Heightened Senses is then used to make sure no enemies are lurking nearby and they pick up a quick kill.
I recommend building Quinn and Valor with a primary focus on physical damage output with a little bit of durability added for the laning phase.
Try Attack Damage Marks, Armor Seals, Magic Resist Glyphs, and Attack Damage Quintessences.
I recommend 21/9/0 Masteries, taking all the physical damage increasing masteries in Offense, plus Health and Armor in Defense.
Barrier, Cleanse, and Flash are great summoner spells for Quinn and Valor, helping them survive tough fights and come out ahead.
Thanks for tuning into the Quinn and Valor Champion Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel and leave us your comments just below the video!

comments.text:
+Bento Kun Ok. 1st. The ulti changes.
If Quinns ulti is changed to like that of Elise, her Skystrike which is the 
strongest ability will be removed. Imagine!0.5 second Skystrikes!
If I were Champion Designer, I would remake her ulti into "When cast on 
herself, Valor will swoop in, this will put this ability in a 5 second 
cooldown." Next part of ultimate is " When cast on enemy, Quinn will 
reappear with an AoE hail of arrows. Putting the ability on a 80/70/60 
second cooldown. When cast on herself, Quinn will reappear, dealing no 
damage and refunds 50% mana and puts this ability on a 5 second cooldown."
That would make Valor uncatchable. So I suggest removing the MS bonus. 
Instead, remake it to "Damaging an enemy unit increases Valors MS by 20 MS. 
Stacks per unit hit and has no cap."

The 2nd. W.
Valor wont be given true sight! He is an eagle,not a froggen magic hawkeye 
birdie. If I were Champion Designer, I would change the W a remake. 
"Passive: Increases Valor's vision range by 100/150/200 units. Active 
Toggle: Valor gains 50/60/70% Atk Spd. Passive is disabled when Active is 
toggled on."
comments.author: Jack of ♢

comments.author: TheMMObro

comments.text:
I would like her to receive the Nid/Elise treatment, allowing her to toggle 
between Quinn and Valor at will. Makes sense with the tag team aspect, 
increase her roaming power which is one of the few reasons to choose her 
atm. Would make her more competitive while retaining all her weaknesses 
such as low aa range, valor being melee form.
That and/or give her W true sight to make her a new role as a stealth 
counter - again increasing her competitiveness. Even a 0/6 Quinn would be 
useful in a teamfight vs akali/twitch/kha'zix if her W had true sight. Both 
easy updates to make her more useful while not op and without reworking her 
whole kit.

comments.text:
Either you always play a champ that Quin usually counters, or you're just 
not as observant. If she has you marked, simply back away and wait for it 
to wear off. She has probably only two escapes, one being Vault and the 
other being Valor. If you can stun or slow Valor in a chase, Quin's done 
for. She's not op - she's a tough champion to play already imo and the fact 
that people can master her is kind of impressive to me.

comments.author: Noobi1Cannonobi

comments.text:
+Noobi1Cannonobi There is a point. You said that if the enemy team is good, 
they would notice. But if the enemy is good why would your allies be that 
bad? In my experience, I signal my team I will be marking the ADC and they 
go clash and kill the MidCarry and squiahy.
Well it is better for Valor to be an assassin than a squishy melee, right?

A trick for Quinn is when Valor will execute, he will R right on mid-dash, 
causing Quinn to jump back. The flaw is her burst takes more than 2 seconds 
and will probably not do it. But it is effective though.
comments.author: Jack of ♢

comments.text:
+Jack of ♢ Exactly, in every way, the other team has to be "distracted" BUT 
a good support never leaves the ADC and you could tell them in chat that 
don't go front line but to peel. If quinn is actually good as an assassin, 
the pros would play her every game... You could wait for the cooldown of 
all supp but by that time, your team probs died already. + the cd doesnt 
refresh after getting to valor. E.G activate E in Quinn form and when you 
ult, E is still on cd.
comments.author: Noobi1Cannonobi

comments.text:
+Noobi1Cannonobi Well no. Their E's range is higher than 600. 650 I think. 
And what I meant is starting from the back of your team, Ulti and then go 
for the nearest possible route to enemy ADC. While it may take you 1-4 
seconds to go, it is worthwhile as they will be distracted by your team 
mates.
comments.author: Jack of ♢

comments.text:
+Jack of ♢ That's only if the other team is crap... As an "assasin" you 
must have a medium high dash range. Valor's E is like Graves auto attack 
range, there is no way that the enemy team can let a freakin valor through 
to the back-line of the team and supports can easily cc and you will die 
instantly. Of course, unless the enemy team is absolutely useless or you 
are just something like 6/0 in lane.
comments.author: Noobi1Cannonobi

comments.text:
Seriously? Crap at teamfights? She aint an ADC in teamfights. She,or should 
I say He(Valor) is an enemy Carry Assassin. Valors burst is so high it can 
100-0 almost anyone. Even the tanky Graves wont do.
comments.author: Jack of ♢

comments.text: +Noobi1Cannonobi You're W passive gives movespeed with harrier autos
comments.author: Bertram Lunt

comments.text:
You don't use Valor form in the later fights. Clean up means to catch and 
end fleeing enemies. Valor is a high mobility assassin. His dueling power 
is very high and has scounting powers. This combined, you can chase after 
anyone who got out of the tf alive. Most of the CDs will be down because of 
the TF's so no one can likely duel you either.

And W gives a flat ms buff everytime you trigger Harrier which makes it 
easy to move around and kite people.
comments.author: Enlight Kamikaze

comments.text:
+Nawadip Rai She cant clean up cause every one just kills u straght away 
when u are valor form even when the whole other team is low. Oh, and how d 
f do u kite with your w?
comments.author: Noobi1Cannonobi

comments.text:
Oh really? 

Q for blinding
W for kiting
E for Kiting 
and R for Execution.

Seriously,do you just judge champions without trying them? She is as good 
as Vayne when it comes to fighting teamfights,given she doesn't have as 
much damage towards tanks. Her mobility is superior in every way and her 
damage mitigation and vault keeps most enemies at bay.

You don't have to do much as an ADC but only survive and place your cards 
right. Besides,there is no other ADC that can clean up the team fight as 
much as she can.
comments.author: Enlight Kamikaze
